etymologies: late Middle English (denoting the laurel or bay tree): from Greek daphnē, from the name of the nymph Daphne

definitions: a small Eurasian shrub with sweet-scented flowers and, typically, evergreen leaves.

notes.text: Genus Daphne, family Thymelaeaceae: several species, including mezereon and spurge laurel

shortDefinitions: small Eurasian shrub with sweet-scented flowers
